meanings.definition: A narrow and steep-sided ravine formed by erosion
meanings.sent1: The hikers carefully navigated the rocky gulches during their adventure.
meanings.sent2: The river carved deep gulches into the canyon walls over centuries.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel hid its acorns in the tiny gulches between the tree roots.
meanings.sent4: Her wrinkled hands resembled the intricate gulches on a map, telling stories of time.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted the vibrant colors of the sunset reflecting in the gulches below.

meanings.definition: To form a gulch or gulches in (land)
meanings.sent1: The heavy rain gulches the soft soil, creating miniature canyons in the backyard.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers gulched the hillside to make way for the new road.
meanings.sent3: The gardener accidentally gulched a small trench while planting flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The sculptor carefully gulches the clay, shaping it into a beautiful vase.
meanings.sent5: The farmer gulches the field to improve water drainage and prevent flooding.
